page.title: 08EVENTS IN N. BREDON HILL
page.content: The Harvest Festival is celebrated by supper and service when children donate food,often in tins,for the needy.Another religious celebration is a pilgramage on Good Friday when a wooden cross is carried to the top of Bredon Hill for a commemorative service.Other events stem from historical happenings such as Oak Apple Day when children dance around a maypole to celebrate the restoration of King Charles II to the throne.From Queen Elizabeth II's Silver Wedding celebrations emanated committees which now organise sporting competitions, dances,discos,wine and cheese parties and coffee mornings.Village fetes are held in Elmley Castle,Bricklehampton, and Little Comberton.
